thread.title: France arrests 15 suspects in Kim Kardashian jewellery robbery
thread.title_full: France arrests 15 suspects in Kim Kardashian jewellery robbery

title: France arrests 15 suspects in Kim Kardashian jewellery robbery
text:
France arrests 15 suspects in Kim Kardashian jewellery robbery 159 reading now twitter TWEET More 
Several people have been arrested and some held for questioning by police in France in connection with the robbery of reality TV star Kim Kardashian in Paris last October. 
French police said at the time that the 36 year-old was robbed at gunpoint of some â‚¬9 million ($A13 million) worth of jewellery by masked men who tied her up in her Paris apartment early on October 3. Why 'mansplaining' should be banned Play Video Kim Kardashian robbers caught on camera Kim Kardashian robbers caught on camera 
Newly released security footage shows what French police believe to be Kim Kardashian's robbers making off with $13 million worth of stolen jewellery. Up Next Why 'mansplaining' should be banned Play Video Why 'mansplaining' should be banned

Music mega star Justin Timberlake dropped in on a Sydney high school to hear them perform. Up Next Coca-Cola wins two 'Fame and Shame' Awards Play Video Coca-Cola wins two 'Fame and Shame' Awards Coca-Cola wins two 'Fame and Shame' Awards 
2016 Parents' Voice Fame and Shame Awards singles out Coca-Cola Australia as a brand using 'shameful marketing techniques' to promote unhealthy food and drink to children. Up Next Daily Life Women of the Year 2016 Play Video Daily Life Women of the Year 2016 
Who were the women that inspired, lead and achieved great things in 2016? Up Next Wrap your Christmas presents like a pro Play Video Wrap your Christmas presents like a pro 
Tips and tricks to make your Christmas presents look like they were wrapped by a professional. More videos Kim Kardashian robbers caught on camera 
Newly released security footage shows what French police believe to be Kim Kardashian's robbers making off with $13 million worth of stolen jewellery. 
Reports by Europe 1 and RTL Radio said 15 people were arrested in all over the robbery, in part thanks to DNA traces left behind. 
RTL said the perpetrators, some disguised as police officers, had fled the scene on foot and on bicycles. SHARE
